alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Dewey; Hand; Hughes; Hyde; Jones; Lyman; Potter; Stanley; Sully (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 19 at 1:06PM MST until February 23 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 15 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. Blizzard conditions possible. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central South Dakota. * WHEN...Although this area could see a couple of inches of light snow during the day on Tuesday, the possible heavy snow could occur from late Tuesday night through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible from late Tuesday night through early Thursday morning. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes this week. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 20 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow could occur on Tuesday, with 1 to 3 inches of snow possible. There could be a break in significant falling snow Tuesday night, before a second round of snow could occur from early Wednesday morning through Thursday morning, with 9 to 12 inches of snow possible. Blizzard conditions could be possible from late Tuesday night through early Thursday morning.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
